intro: Frankenia leonardorum, commonly known as the Leonard's frankenia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow-orange flowers and succulent, fleshy leaves adapted to arid environments. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal dunes and dry scrublands. Frankenia leonardorum is an important species for ecological studies due to its unique adaptations to harsh, semi-arid climates.
